intro: Ceropegia maharashtrensis, commonly known as the Maharashtra ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to the western Ghats of India. It is a perennial herb with tuberous roots and distinctive, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
